column5: Wow !!!! Awesome fishing guys !!!! Phil those pike a huge man !!!! Amazing !!!!! Congrats
Good job man, that's the proper way to treat those big girls
Thanks for the comments folks. We take a great deal of pride in catching and releasing the big pike LV has to offer. It was a good trip spent with some good people.  Cheers

Johnson Silver Minnow that is.   A little bigger  A lot bigger   The fish above were all caught on a silver Johnson Silver Minnow with a four inch pearl white twister tail. These and many others were caught on 6/2/14. My boat partner and private photographer was the famous "TennesseeGuy"  Connie Inman.   The fishing was great. The fresh walleye dinners were fantastic. Spending a week in NWO is priceless.  Cheers
Outstanding Phil !!
Thats GATOR porn at it,s best  WOW  Johnson silver minnow you say. Sometimes old dogs dont need new tricks.  Well done.
Nice!
real nice
Talk about a masterful day of Esox slayin!  I also love the Johnson Silver Minnow with the 4" white twister.  Congrats to you and Tennessee Guy for a successful trip!
Fantastic esox there,  Phil. I'd sacrifice a body part or two to spend a day on the water with Connie. Thanks so much for sharing.
Wow, that is one old lookin momma gator in that last pic. Those are some very nice specimens!
If it wasn't for TG I don't know if I would have ever experienced our location
Nice going Whopper.  Great pics.
Wow - would love a shot at some of those. Very nice.
sweet god those are beautiful specimens !
Hey Whopper  Some beauty Pike there!!  Those girls get the adrenaline flowing.  Very nice Rick
ive seen lotsa pike. I must admit you guys did awesome.
Nice Phil!!
hey whopper, did you find the name tags Connie put on the fish, which one was bruce, or harry?
hey whopper, did you find the name tags Connie put on the fish, which one was bruce, or harry?   I was good to meet you and but a face to a name, you have a slice of heaven where your at.
Okay well you lived up to your username good lord!!
Nice gators!  Any measurements taken?

BillM, no measurements.    Fish were out of the water for only a few seconds.   Big net, but no cradle which would have allowed for checking length.   Most of our fish were released without being netted.    Many were unhooked in the net and swam away when the net was pulled away from them.   All of our pike were caught on single hooks (jigs and JSM).    I tried Suicks, but pike weren't eating Suicks that week.  For the 3 photos the fish were unhooked in the net, taken out of the water about 20 seconds for a photo and then back to the net to be sure they were fully recovered before pulling the net from under them.  Nothing touched our fish except for wet hands.  Over the years I've seen several silver pike, but Phil's is probably the largest I've seen.   She didn't have any holes in her mouth from previous hooks.  We managed to bring in several nice pike every day.  I'm missing NW Ontario.    Will probably be back up there next month.
Great pictures Phil! Beautiful pike!
Holy moly!!!  Whoppers for sure!  S.
How is Kevin? He hasn't posted in ages.
Wow, great job Phil.  Outstanding fish there.  Another one in the books for you and Connie eh!
That lake is known to have some great pike Phil.  Looks like you found a few.  Great pics.
